oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "The Old Contraband"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sheet music. Cover depicts a stereotypical image of a freedman.

"Contraband of war" was the term used to refer to the thousands of slaves who fled to Union lines. Some Union officers returned fugitive slaves to their masters, but contraband persons often proved themselves useful in the army workforce.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sheet music; Freedmen; Slavery; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Songs and music
Music
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: John F. Ziber and Rudolph Wittig
